Name: Space Lunch: Combo Beverage
Description:
This mini-expansion for Space Lunch is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds 3 new Combo cards to the base game of Space Lunch; each of these Combo cards allows players to reactivate their previously used coupon by discarding a specific set of 5 cards. Additionally, this expansion also adds new player aid cards which change the rules for Beverage cards.

Name: Blue's Clues I Spy
Description: Players choose one of six game boards to play with together.  Each of the boards has ten objects hidden on it.  Each hidden object has a card associated with it.  Players flip the cards, one at a time, and try to be the first to find the object on the card on the game board.

Name: Rebis: Golden Book
Description:
This mini-expansion for Rebis is part of the "Achievements" series of Matchbox Collection mini-expansions, and as such should only be opened and used once the 3 criteria on its envelope have been met; because of this...

SPOILER ALERT:

This expansion adds a new set of 9 Golden Book cards (numbered 1 to 9), as well as a Homunculus token, to the base game of Rebis; these new Golden Book cards can be drafted to players' shelves during gameplay, and when they are placed, they also increase the multiplier of that shelf by placing the Homunculus token on the 2x multiplier space, permanently pushing any existing mixture tokens to the right.

Name: Деловые люди (Business people)
Description:
Economic game. Buy cooperatives and equities, collect rent from fellow players. Repeat as necessary until everyone else is bankrupt.

Players take turns in order. A turn begins with the rolling of the dice and moving the piece around the board the corresponding number of squares.

If a player lands on Fortune cell he draws the card from the pile and obeys its instructions. If the player stops on a cell with an unowned cooperative, he can buy the entity for the listed price. He can decline the purchase. In this case, the entity keeping available for the other players. If the cell with the entity already owned by another player, he must pay the owner's rent (the price will be noticed on the card based on the level of the cooperative entity). Also, a board contains the special cells for equities exchange. Each full round on the board the cost of equities change and player can sell them to increase own cash or to buy other equities by a lower price.

Name: Diver Down Deep
Description:
A competitive card game for 2-4 players played over a number of 6-card hands until one player achieves the required gold to win.

Each player is a deep sea diver trying to find one of many sunken Spanish Galleons which may or may not have gold. Each diver is dealt 6 "Depth" cards and given two single coin treasure cards. The "Depth" cards consist of two suits - Octopus and Anchor and are numbered from 1 to 16 (meters). There are also two wild cards which are equal to zero meters of depth and may be used in forming discount hands or to deceive your fellow divers as to how many total meters may be in your hand.

Through discarding sets of two or three cards, the diver lowers the number of total "meters" held in their hand. Once the total is below 8, the diver may opt to declare "diver down" and claim the top most Treasure card. But be careful, another diver may have a lower amount of meters in hand and declare "Diver Down Deep" and claim that treasure instead, as well as claiming a single gold coin treasure card from the original declarer.

First diver to obtain Treasure cards totaling 10 gold coins is declared the winner.

Name: Afterglow
Description:
Afterglow is the hyperlight space skirmish wargame set in the far future. The players assume the role of STARCORE Commanders, a hybrid of human sentience and an alien supercomputer, and control a task force of hyper-sophisticated warships in objective-based battles.

Players design their task force of one to three ships using cards, then plot their actions against one another simultaneously. There is no randomization and every action pushes a game towards it's definitive conclusion. Every attack is potentially lethal and there is no armour. The only protection is for the ships to briefly travel back through time and space to a safe location: this is known as the Afterglow effect.

—description from the designer

Name: Afterglow: Outer Dark
Description:
Outer Dark is an expansion for Afterglow, the hyperlight space combat game. In Outer Dark, humanity is being pushed to the brink of extinction by advanced spacefacing Bioships of an unknown origin. Rather than continuing to war with each other, STARCORE Commanders are being called upon to fight to protect the human race as a whole in a rearguard battle while a solution to the crisis is found.

Outer Dark introduces the Biocraft, which are fully controlled by an automata. This allows for a solitaire or cooperative experience for players. The Biocraft may be engaged in one-off battles, or players can use the rules for the campaign where players maintain a persistent fleet of ships. They're also required to manage the strategic resources of a sector while managing it's evacuation as the Biocraft assault the sector.

-description from designer

Name: Lucky Numbers
Description:
Players attempt to win chip pots based on lottery numbers turned over on the game board. Six green number cards are placed on the board, with the first three turned over. Players are then dealt cards from a red deck and ante chips under each of the cards on the board.

On their turn, a player may either play a card towards the board or draw one if they don’t have any numbers that match. Players must then discard one card at the end of their turn, regardless of whether they play a card or not. When a player can match the three number combination, they claim the pot under the third card, then turn over the fourth card. Play continues the same as before, with the fifth and sixth cards revealed once the previous pots are claimed. The player with the most chips at the end wins.

Name: Mr. Machine Game
Description: The object of the game is to get your Mr. Machine marker to the toy factory while avoiding hazards on the game board. Players move around the board by using various parts of a replica of the Mr. Machine toy that was sold around the same time. The first player to successfully get their Mr. Machine token to the toy factory is the winner.

Name: Alpha
Description:
Entrepreneurial tycoons in the year 3113 spend scant portions of their vast fortunes hiring unscrupulous scientists to bioengineer ferocious creatures to compete on a remote island in "Alpha", the world’s most brutal blood sport not banned by the International Broadcasting Memorandum. In this two-player hidden movement deck-building hand management game, each player will assume the actions of one dangerous predator that exists to achieve one objective: reign as the Alpha.

How do they do this? Players will choose seven action cards, each of which represents the passage of one hour of time, from their available deck to play that round. Players then take actions simultaneously, resolve them, and repeat the process until each player has one card remaining (*), which gets upgraded based on the player's current location on the board.

Player's creatures can Move around the map, Hunt the piddling local wildlife to avoid Howl penalties, and Track their opponent to ascertain their location. Players must also navigate un-upgradable Sleep and Scat actions that make it harder for them to stay undetected. Players who perform the final available action, Sneak Attack!, lay it all on the line. They either win the game, or let their opponent know exactly where to find them.

(*) Unless their opponent has located them, in which case, game over. Chin up...they've got that creature's DNA sequencing on file somewhere...

Name: Fahrt ins Grune
Description: The players start their journey to various leisure activities around the board. The first player to reach space 90 wins the game.

Name: Capital Lux 2: Mini-Expansion
Description:
This mini-expansion comes with 3 different modules that can be played together or one by one, each of them compatible with both Capital Lux 2: Generation and Capital Lux 2: Pocket.

Modules:
Superpower Card
Postcard
Kingdom Card

Name: Die Bremer Stadtmusikanten
Description:
The cards are evenly distributed among the players. One player gets no card, he reads the fairy tale aloud, while emphasizing the bold typed words. Whenever another player finds an image of the emphasized word, he covers it with a cardboard square. The first player to cover all images on his card or cards wins the game.

Curious: The same card wins every time (if the owner makes no mistakes), because the order of the emphasized words in the story never changes. So the winner is already determined with the distribution of the cards.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Town Musicians of Bremen

Name: クトゥルフが目覚める前に (Cthulhu ga mezameru mae ni)
Description:
Five explorers are trying to prevent the rising of the undersea kingdom of R’lyeh and the awakening of Great Cthulhu with it. To achieve their goal, the Disk of R’lyeh must be destroyed. However, the Starknife – an artefact necessary to the task – has disappeared. One of the explorers must have hidden it! It can be anywhere, and finding it is not a simple thing. The fact that time is of the essence does not leave much to hesitate, either…

Before Cthulhu Awakens (ã‚¯ãƒˆã‚¥ãƒ«ãƒ•ãŒç›®è¦šã‚ã‚‹å‰ã«), the 1st title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

Name: インスマスから届いた手紙 (Innsmouth kara todoita tegami)
Description:
Five characters who had experienced a terrifying past in the cursed town of Innsmouth. Their forgotten childhood memories are fragmented on 30 cards. Use this information to uncover the identity of the cursed child together.

Letter from Innsmouth (ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒžã‚¹ã‹ã‚‰å±Šã„ãŸæ‰‹ç´™), another title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

Name: 黄衣の王がやってくる前に (Koui no Ou ga yattekuru mae ni)
Description:
Five characters mysteriously vanish while shooting a movie of the infamous play, “The King in Yellow”, only to find themselves in a strange place. Based on their testimonies, try to find a way out of this domain.

Before the King in Yellow Cometh (é»„è¡£ã®çŽ‹ãŒã‚„ã£ã¦ãã‚‹å‰ã«), another title in ARCLIGHT’s Mystery Portable Series, is a cooperative deduction game set in the Cthulhu Mythos, with simple rules just by flipping cards.

Compared to the previous game, Letter from Innsmouth (ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ãƒžã‚¹ã‹ã‚‰å±Šã„ãŸæ‰‹ç´™), in which players unravel horrifying childhood memories, this work is a suspense thriller – a tense escape drama set in a another world.

The ending may change depending on the number of cards flipped!

Name: Wildak Town
Description:
A monopoly-like game set in a village with shops and companies. Players are parents that try to collect as much money and shops to secure the future of their children.

Wildak town is a game of the 50's in wich rolemodels and career choices were different, or in fact in line with that decade. Women/girls do caring and providing jobs and men/boys do hard labor and management. The avarage (Dutch) family in the 30's to 60's consisted of a lot of children and all must contribute in their living.
Besides their jobs, once or twice a year some entertainment came to town; e.a cycling/tour/giro/velodrome and a carnaval/luna-park; both depicted on the gameboard. This is where you can try your luck to earn just that little bit more money this year.

Wildak town likes to be a family game, where everyone can relate to (again; time-appropiate).
To keep it interesting and a family game; time limit for this game is a maximum of 1 or 2 hours, or if all your family members (in the game) are dead.

Name: Voll Vereiert
Description: Voll Vereiert is a roll-and-write-game where players try to find Easter eggs on their lawn. One players throws a single die each round and in each round the players have to graze one field on their lawn. If the number on the egg on this field is equal to the number on the die they find an Easter egg. The first player to find 4 of the same or 6 different eggs will win.

Name: Οι Εφοπλιστές (The Shipowners)
Description:
Οι ΕφοπλιστÎ­ς (oi efoplistes) is a board game published by Greek company MIKA in 1991.

The game is a simulation of merchant shipping. It takes place all over the world. Each player has a vessel (or two in a 2-players game) for shipping commodities (food and machinery) from city to city. But they also have to pay attention on weather, fuel management and of course to make the best deals about cargoes.

Take your boats and transport boxes of food and machinery throughout the world. The fastest and most methodical will collect the most money and will be the final winner.

—user summary

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Alaska
Description:
The Alaska-class fell midway between a heavy cruiser and a battleship, and the United States Navy considered these vessels large cruisers rather than battlecruisers. 
They were designed as cruiser-killers, tasked with destroying post-Washington Treaty heavy cruisers. As a result, they were given 12-inch guns, significant armour protection, and could travel at up to 33 knots. They resembled current generation battleships in appearance, with the familiar two forward, one aft main battery turrets, massive columnar mast and a multitude of 5-inch dual purpose guns along the sides of the superstructure. However, they were built to cruiser standards, lacking the armoured belt and torpedo defence of capital ships.

Commissioned late into the war, USS Alaska saw limited service. 
Operations included those off Iwo Jima and Okinawa in early 1945, such as anti-aircraft defence in carrier task forces and shore bombardment. 
After the war, she participated in the Korean occupation. 
She was decommissioned in February 1947.

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Iowa
Description:
One of the largest battleships ever built. 
Based superficially on the South Dakota-class, the USS Iowa had heavier armour and was 200 ft. longer. It was also incredibly fast, due to increased output from the engines, and its greater size allowed it to mount more anti-aircraft guns, making it a formidable prospect for attacking planes. Invariably used as flagships for task forces, the Iowa-class was also supremely equipped to act as escorts for the fast carrier fleets of the Pacific.

During World War Two, USS Iowa transported President Franklin D. Roosevelt across the Atlantic to Algeria, bound for the conference with Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin in 1943. 
Transferred to the Pacific fleet the following year, her operations including the preparatory shore bombardments at Kwajalein and Eniwetok and the screening of carriers around the Marshall Islands. 
She was present for the Japanese surrender in Tokyo Bay, serving as the flagship of the Third Fleet under Admiral William F. Halsey. 
She would go on to serve in the Korean War before being decommissioned into the “mothball fleet”. 
Reactivated in 1984 in efforts to counteract the expanding Soviet Navy she was finally decommissioned after 19 total years of active service in 1990. Today she serves as the USS Iowa Museum at the Port of Los Angeles.

—description from the publisher

Name: Victory at Sea: USS Hornet
Description:
USS Hornet was a Yorktown class-carrier serving in the Pacific Theatre during World War Two. 
She launched the Doolittle Raid (the first air operation to strike the Japanese Archipelago) on 18 April 1942. 
She later participated in the crucial Battle of Midway as well as the Buin-Faisi-Tonolai Raid. 
As part of the Solomon Islands campaign, USS Hornet was involved in both the capture and defence of Guadalcanal and the Battle of the Santa Cruz Islands. 
It was during these latter operations that she was irreparably damaged by enemy aircraft. Abandoned by her crew, she was sunk by an encroaching force of Japanese Destroyers – her sinking marked the last US fleet carrier to have been sunk by enemy action.

Of the Yorktown-class aircraft carriers, built in a series of three, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway. 
The USS Enterprise went on to become the most frequently decorated US carrier of the war, even earning the British Admiralty Pennant, the only ship outside of the Royal Navy to do so. 
She was finally put out of action in 1945 by a kamikaze attack that severely damaged the hanger deck.

—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Kreuz der Auslese Promo
Description:
An Aventuria adventure for four heroes.

Description of publisher:
Aventuria-Szenario für vier Helden.

Name: Aventuria: Promo-Pack 1
Description:
Promo Pack #1 consists of the cards:
Schwarzes Auge
Verlockender Köder
Orkfamilie
Schwitzkasten

The cards are shrinkwrapped together with a cover card on top.

Name: Aventuria: Promo-Pack 2
Description:
Promo Pack #2 consists of the cards:
Improvisierte Waffe
Schlösser knacken
Rahjasutra
Zechgelage

The cards are shrinkwrapped together with a cover card on top.

Name: Aventuria: Promo-Pack 3
Description:
Promo Pack #3 consists of the cards:
Schlagring
Nachahmung
Liebestrank
Drachenjunges

The cards are shrinkwrapped together with a cover card on top.

Name: Aventuria: Begleiter #1 – Hunde Promopack
Description:
This promo pack contains four dog companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Bornländer
Esper Saupacker
Nivesischer Steppenhund
Tuzaker

Name: Yokai Quest Strikes Back
Description:
Welcome to Yokai Quest
Yokai Quest is a game where players lead a group of heroes who must face a multitude
of enemies and dangers.
The main enemies of the heroes are the Yokai, mythological creatures from Japanese
folklore. Each Yokai has its own distinctive traits and abilities, from the evil Oni, to the
funny Tengu, to the prankster Tanuki. But they are not the only enemies the heroes
must face, the world of Yokai hides a multitude of hidden dangers.
Throughout the campaign, the players will follow the plot of a story that will take them
through different scenarios, where they will have to face all kinds of challenges. After
each scenario, win or lose, the plot will continue until the story is complete.
Yokai quest has been designed with simplicity in mind, so that anyone, of any age group
and knowledge, can play yokai quest after just one reading of this rulebook.
But let’s not waste anymore time! We know you are itching to start, so let us go right
into the world of Yokai Quest.

Yokai Quest Strikes Back brings with it the following changes and improvement to the original Yokai Quest!

Major Upgrades:
1.  Major revision to the rulebook and Gameplay. We did not just fix the rulebook, we have now completely revised the game. Yokai Quest Strikes back difficulty level has been designed to be challenging for experienced players while at the same time a Little Heroes mode (Easy mode) has also been created for children and new players.
2. The original Yokai Quest had 16 scenarios. Yokai Quest Strikes Back brings you +20 scenarios in a separate, new +80 pages campaign book!

Gameplay Tweaks:

Strategy
    1. Hero movement : Movement is now an action. Heroes no longer have costless movement. Additionally, leaving a square adjacent to a yokai will now cost double. Players will now need to strategically plan their hero movement and placement.
    2. Friendly Fire : Powerful abilities have been tweaked - in general, heroes can no longer unleash a skill without a care in the world : swinging their sword at their allies will cause significant damage! The addition of friendly fire means that hero position, skill choice and energy expenditure decision is now even more strategic!
    3. Players may no longer swap items at any time during their phase. Swapping items from the inventory to the hero board can now only be done during the "take a breather" phase, at the end of a hero turn.
    4. Energy token management : Energy tokens can now be used to recharge a skill. This adds another level of strategy to the energy token management. Do you recharge a skill, or save the energy to unleash another skill?
    5. The concept of Line of Sight has been added to the game
    6. Terrain elements have been properly incorporated into the game. There are more strategic decisions to be made around these elements, such as Shrubs, Magic Barriers, altars and monoliths.

Spawn Rate and Yokai Difficulty level
    1. Yokai Spawn rate has been modified , there is now the normal mode (harder), and an easy mode.
    2. Additionally, each spawn point will now spawn a yokai each turn, unless specified otherwise by the scenario conditions
    3. Yokais attributes, attack and defense stats have been tweaked and modified.

Additional changes
    1. Heroes no longer receive treasure tokens for defeating a Yokai, unless specified by scenario conditions. Treasures must be earned!
    2. Skills or Abilities have been completely revamped. Each Hero now begins their adventure with a limited number of skills, and are able to purchase more powerful skills with the victory points (experience) they gained during their adventures.

Download the new rules here:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1_Swi9sXRXel9ejZ9PeCtpSLnqe9udPNs?usp=sharing

New campaing on kickstarter, suscribe in:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/zenitminiatures/yokai-quest-strikes-back

Name: Aventuria: Begleiter #2 – Katzen Promopack
Description:
This promo pack contains four cat companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Aranier
Cah ay Zhamorrah
Nuala
Scheunenkatz

Name: Aventuria: Begleiter #3 – Pferde Promopack
Description:
This promo pack contains four horse companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Maultier
Elenviner Vollblut
Tralloper Riese
Warunker

Name: Aventuria: Begleiter #4 – Exotische Tiere Promopack
Description:
This promo pack contains four exotic animal companion cards and a rules card for companions:
Sturmfalke
Moosaffe
Vogelspinne
Speikobra

Name: Aventuria: Alrik Immerdar Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card ("Magischer Flügelhelm") and deck construction card for Alrik.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Hexer Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Alwinja (Schwarze Katze)" and rules card for the alternate hero Salakir Velvetpaw, Bornlandian Cat Witch.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Namenlosen Geweihte Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Verfluchtes Relikt (Al’Hani)" and rules card for the alternate hero Astralia Mordenstar, Blessed One of the Nameless One.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Söldnerin Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Lederschild (Elburisch)" and rules card for the alternate hero Hektabe Meatcutter, Tobrian Mercenary.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Alchemist Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Praioron Forte (Pastillen)" and rules card for the alternate hero Laborix Goldmaker, Mengbillian Magical Alchemist.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Schatzjägerin Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Südweiser (Thorwalisch)" and rules card for the alternate hero Pelara Kroftoff, Festumian Explorer.

Name: Aventuria: Alternate Buskur Promopack
Description: This promo pack contains the hero card, skill card, life point card, action card "Treuer Begleiter (Maraske)" and rules card for the alternate hero Rondrajin Firekraut, Maraskan Buskur.

Name: Jim Prentice Electric Whiz Checkers
Description:
This game is played like regular checkers except you press the Electric Spindicator when it is your turn. Where it stops determines how many spaces\players they can move:

"0" - player doesn't move - pass to next player
"1" - payer must move one checker one space diagonally forward
"2" - player must move either one checker two spaces or two checks one space each.
"3" - player must move either one checker three spaces, three checkers one space or one checker one space and one checker two spaces.

Continuous jumps are considered one move.

Moving backward and forward between two squares with a king is not permitted on a multiple move.

Name: Abomination: The Heir of Frankenstein – The Secret Cabal Promo Cards
Description:
Promo pack of three new cards released for "The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast is at Full Froth in 2020!" Kickstarter campaign.

Blue-Eyed Butcher (Scoundrel) - Even the pets aren't safe.
Moral Dilemma (Humanity) - 'Tis a dangerous game you play.
Understudy (Research) - Good help is hard to find.

-description from designer

Name: Farms and Factories: Inventions
Description:
A shrewd investor builds Greenhouses and Observatories to help her fund critical research. A young business tycoon stumbles upon the Telegraph, catapulting him ahead of his peers. A group of like minded individuals decide the new invention Dynamite might help them... level the playing field. In Farms & Factories: Inventions, everyone has a chance to change the world and maybe score a few points along the way.

In Farms & Factories: Inventions (as in Farms & Factories) players draw and play Action & Building cards from a communal deck until it runs out of cards. Inventions adds a new card type, Tech, which is shuffled into a separate deck at the beginning of the game. Unlike with Actions or Buildings, a player must patent a Tech before it can be played by discarding cards from their point pile. This means each Tech requires careful analysis to decide if it will pay off in the lost points. Tech cards are very powerful however, with lasting effects that can be used as soon as they are played, and often shape a player's strategy.

In additional to 30 unique Techs, Farms & Factories: Inventions adds 35 new Buildings and Actions, adding complexity and strategical depth to the original game.

-description from publisher

Name: Cardopolis
Description:
Cardopolis is a solo or cooperative game where you as mayor (or co-mayor) are responsible for guiding the growth of your city to be the biggest, best city possible while protecting it from disasters!

The game is played in two Stages: 
- Town stage
- City stage
During each stage, you will draw cards, play zone and building cards to grow your city, and resolve disasters.

The goal is to build your city to have the greatest Population by the end of the City stage.

-description from designer

Name: The Inheritance
Description:
The McClains are one of the oldest and richest families in Valley Falls. So when the current patriarch of the family, Edison McClain, asks for your help and is willing to make it worth your time, how can you say no? Edison was planning on naming his heir and the next head of the family. So he called together all of the McClains and proposed a game as a last test to see the worthiness of those he deemed had potential. But someone in the family had other ideas. During the family get-together, the McClain’s oldest and most prized possession, a medallion bearing the household’s coat of arms, was stolen. This 500-year-old family heirloom is believed by the family to be the reason for their wealth and success throughout the years. Without the medallion Edison can’t name his heir, and he fears the family will fall into ruin. Will you be able to find the thief and the medallion? Can you recover The Inheritance?

Difficulty Level - 7/10

Name: The Watcher
Description: Allison Zeller has a secret admirer. She thinks the mysterious guy is sweet enough at first until his behavior escalates past simple admiration and spirals into full-blown obsession. Someone is stalking her and growing impatient that they can't have her. This infatuation culminates in a full-blown attack on Allison's life, leaving her at death's door. It's likely that whoever did this to her will come back to finish what they started. Can you find out the identity of Allison's stalker before it's too late? Can you unmask The Watcher?

Name: Isogame
Description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players.

Each player has 4 tiles - 1 of each isogram.  These are placed on their end of the board matching the isogram and the direction its facing (orientation).  Using the roulette wheel, pieces are moved and rotated per the wheel's diagrams.

The goal is for one player to land their isograms on the  matching squares (color and orientation) of the opponent's baseline (or his matching tile piece) and remove their own piece from the board.  The first player to remove their four pieces from the board wins.

Name: Prime Ordeal: Genesis
Description:
In Prime Ordeal, two or more players take turns drafting armies from a "Spawning Pool" (a face-up collection of Creature and Bonus cards that all players have access to) to get ready for battle. Each creature has a Power Level, represented by a single number. These numbers are added together to form a player's Total Power Level when battling. As the game progresses, so does each player's army and Total Power Level.

To draft (referred to as "Create" in game), players discard combinations of Prime cards from their hands into the Prime card discard pile. Each Creature or Bonus card features a Creation Cost, specifying the combination of Prime cards necessary to create it. The Creation Cost may feature any combination of the following Prime card types: Bug, Sea, Bird, Reptile, Mammal, and Amphibian. Creatures themselves have types that directly correspond to their Creation Cost.  Players are encouraged to collect creatures that share types to increase synergy and for better chances at acquiring Bonus cards.

After each player takes a turn Creating, the round concludes with a mandatory, free-for-all style battle. Each player's Power Level is compared and those with the highest or tied for highest Power Level win the battle, while each other player loses a Life.

Players draft in between each battle and the game continues until only one player remains with any Life. The amount of Life chosen before the game will determine how long a game lasts. It is recommended to start players at 7 (short game), 11 (medium-length game), or 13 Life (long game).

This strategic, card-based brawler features a modular design.  The core set, Genesis, functions as a standalone game.  Players may purchase expansions and shuffle them directly into the core set to change the game entirely. Groups may decide on which expansions to include and which to omit for a customizable gaming experience. Prime Ordeal is traditionally played as a free-for-all; however, its design accommodates team play as well.

-description from publisher

Name: Mingo
Description:
The game is designed to help familiarize one with the multiplication table. The objective of the game is to cover numbers on a circular board with their own markers. First player to do so wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Metcon: The Metcon Traffic Game
Description:
A traffic simulation game to teach road rules to new drivers.

Each player takes a pair of cars and moves them by rolling dice.  Road hazards are introduced at numbered squares.  Hazards are played out and fines assigned and paid at court.
Event cards give and remove points. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Horn of Plenty
Description: Horn of Plenty  is a trick-taking card game in which four players win tricks by matching colors on cards and also gain generosity tokens by being nice to the other players.

Name: Planet of the Pugs
Description:
There was a devasted planet called Earth.
Once were habitated by human beings, and not only: then they came.
Pugs. All over it!

Planet of the Pugs is a cooperative game for 2 up to 6 survivors, running time about 20'-30', 8+.

During their turn, players can play up 2 action (a mandatory one + an optional one) then the Pugs run their cards, to determine Devastation.

Mandatory Action: 
- Draw 2 cards

Optional Actions: 
- Play 1 card from the hand
- Block Devastation – discard 4 copies of the same object to turn down by 1 level the Devastation and take a Special Relic
- Switch Object with other player

World Action:
- Draw many Devastation cards, looking to the players’ cards and to reached level.

Devastation bar has 12 levels and 4 steps.
Each step add a difficulty level like not to talk at all or play cards from other player hand.
The more Devastation bar increase the more World Action will increase too.

Three Ending Game Condition
• SURVIVE: the players get up to 5 Special Relics to create the Final Defense!
• DEATH: a player lose 3 life points
• DEVASTATION: the Devastation Counter reach the Max level

Name: Wordsworth
Description:
A 2-player word game using the same mechanics as Mastermind.

The Wordmaker (player 1) creates a word at the top of the board and hides it with a screen. The Wordbreaker (player 2) tries to guess the word by placing Yellow pegs in the board to indicate the letter and its position in the word. The Wordmaker than replaces the Yellow pegs with Black or White Pegs to indicate if the correct letter comes before or after the guessed letter.  If the letter is guessed correctly, the Yellow peg stays on the board.

Points are scored for the number of tries it takes to guess the word.  The player with the lowest total score of all rounds wins.

Name: NASCAR: Desktop 500
Description:
Start Your Engines! Now you can hold your own series on desktops everywhere!

Players decide on the number of laps they want to complete, and place their car in the lane of their choice. On their turn turn, they spin the spinner to either move their car the number of spaces indicated, or follow the directions of the black flag space indicated. Whoever completes the determined number of laps first wins.

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Completionist Guise Promo Card
Description:
A promo card for the game Sentinels of the of the Multiverse. It was available with Ultimate Collector's Case and is also included in Complete Hero Variant Collection.

Completionist Guise

Innate Power: "Impressive Collection" - Replace a hero character cards in play with a variant of that hero. Put the replaced cards safely under this card. Either use the power on the replaced card (treating any hero names on that card as "Guise") or Guise deals 1 target 2 psychic damage.

Name: SYNK!
Description:
The new, fast-paced card game that combines wordplay, trivia and a dash of deception!

Each round begins with a player selecting a card which will give them a secret word. They must then reveal the first letter of the word to the group.

Players then begin thinking of words beginning with the revealed letter. Anything goes! The aim is to come up with clues that other players will be able to SYNK with you without the cardholder figuring it out.  When you've thought of your SYNK! word propose the definition to all players. If another player thinks they know you lock eyes, countdown from 3 and... SYNK! If the two players guess correctly then the next letter of the secret word is revealed. Now all players need to think of a word that starts with the first AND SECOND letter of the secret word. However if the cardholder also guessed the SYNK! word then it's back to square one. The game continues until a player thinks they know the secret word.

If a round comes to a halt with players struggling to figure out the secret word, then the cardholder must reveal its definition. The first player to think they know the answer must then shout “SYNK!”. If a player is able to either correctly SYNK! the secret word with another player or guess the word from the definition they win the round. If players SYNK! or guess incorrectly the cardholder wins. First player to win three cards is the victor and gets full bragging rights - until the next game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Dark Watch The Harpy Promo Card
Description:
These is a variant card for The Harpy (it has different HP/Power from the other card).

HP 27

Power: Refocus

Flip one control token. You may play a card.

Name: Nähdään Kosken Rannassa
Description:
Trivia game about one of Finland's cities, Tampere. The game has 900 questions and is suitable for everyone who wants to learn more about Tampere.

The name of the game means "See you at the rapids" and refers to the Tammerkoski rapids that run straight through the city (although now largely covered/developed) from lake Näsijärvi - itself one of the largest lakes in Finland and an important means of communication and trade before the advent of railways and the motor car - to lake Pyhäjärvi, and which the city was originally developed around; the rapids provided a ready source of power for the weaving mills, paper mills, engineering works etc. of the emerging industrial revolution of the 19th century and started Tampere on the path to becoming what it now is.

The game is basically the Tampere edition of NÃ¤hdÃ¤Ã¤n kellon alla!, the original version set in Helsinki. Unlike that version however, this is not completely bilingual; only 300 of the 900 questions have been translated to Swedish and there's a separate deck for those cards, furthermore the cards are not categorized but simply have the "easy" or "difficult" option on them.

Name: Mist Fleet
Description:
In Mist Fleet, each player leads a battleship fleet. The object of the game is destroy all of your opponent's ships.
In each turn player fire cannon to opponent's fleet, opponent announce hit or miss, but they can lie.But this game is also suitable for those are not good at lying, because all lying ablity is given by ship itself.

Each player has 6 ships and 6 empty sea cards,place their 12 cards face down to form a 4x3 formation
Each player on his turn has 2 actions.
For each action, player has 3 options
1) Attack directly: attack 1 of opponent's card. The opponent look at his card. If it is a ship, he say “Hit”, if it is not a ship, he say “Miss”. Put “Hit” or “Miss” token on that card.
2ï¼‰Attack adjacently: attack a space between two cards. The opponent look at both his cards. If either of them is a ship, he say “Hit”; if neither of them is a ship, he say “Miss”. Place “Hit” or “Miss” token between margin of two cards.
Whenever a ship's life point is equal of below 0 (life points on card minus “Hit” on the ship card and around the ship card), the ship is sunk. Ship's owner shall flip the card face up.
3) Radar scan. Scan one cross point of two margin lines. Opponent look at his cards around scan point.Opponent count all this cards current life point and say that number. Put a radar scan number token on that point.

Basic game is for 2 players. Support up to 4 players by using two copies of game.

åœ¨ã€Šé›¾æµ·èˆ°é˜Ÿã€‹ä¸­ï¼ŒçŽ©å®¶å°†å¸¦é¢†è‡ªå·±çš„èˆ°é˜Ÿï¼Œåœ¨è¿·é›¾ä¹‹æµ·ä¸­ä¸Žå¯¹æ‰‹å†³æˆ˜ã€‚çŽ©å®¶å¯ä»¥é€šè¿‡ç‚®å‡»æˆ–é›·è¾¾æ‰«æçš„æ–¹å¼ï¼Œæ‰¾å‡ºå¹¶æ‘§æ¯å¯¹æ‰‹çš„èˆ°é˜Ÿã€‚æœ€å…ˆå‡»æ¯æ•Œæ–¹æ‰€æœ‰æˆ˜èˆ°çš„çŽ©å®¶èŽ·èƒœã€‚

Name: FAD
Description:
FAD is a 2 player card game that puts you in the heart of gameplay. Score points by doing 'Activities' with your 'Friends', while avoiding any 'Delays'. The first to 100 points wins. The game is available as a print & play product.

Design your own character from a series of pre-made faces (like in a computer game RPG) to bring yourself into the game.

The game is a really fun, super easy to learn, card game with strategy and a little bit of luck.

There are 120 cards including:

x60 Friends cards
x30 Activity cards
x30 Delay card

Name: Lakelandopoly
Description: How do you make a game about the great city of Lakeland, FL? While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the LAKELAND we could into this box. It's full of family fun, outdoor activities,  Florida history and of course... lakes, a little something for everyone! Looking for a fun way to experience Swan City? Here's a quick idea of how to play! Buy your favorite LAKELAND properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! Get your game on! So choose your token and advance to GO LAKELAND! You may soon be the Mayor...or out of the game for eating too much pizza at the Silver Moon Snack Bar.

Name: Talita
Description:
The Talisman Pocket Game

Comes in a paper bag with illustration and title on the front and rules of the game for the war games on the back; The bag is 22 x 14 cm.

The rules describe two simple games, the Target Flight Game and the Capture Ships game.

Contents: 

     4 cardboard cards with the color-illustrated game boards for the Target Flight game.
     8 game boards (2 per card) on the back of the Target Flight Game for the Capture Ships game. I believe the original game came with a small pencil.

Name: FindOut Medieval
Description:
This game will transport you into the magic and mystery of the medieval era. Choose your character, move with cunning among the rooms of the Castle and meet as many characters as possible. Let them help you find out who is hiding in the royal rooms and especially in the Princess’s room! Your Powers, together with those of the Special Cards, can benefit you but don’t let them escape and use them at the right moment… An engaging strategy game for all ages, with simple cards that will turn into squares to go through, recreating a mystery and an ever-changing story for each game. '

—description from the designer

Name: 16th Avenue: The Country Music Game
Description:
In 16th Avenue players try to make it in the country music industry of the 1980s. The board spaces players move through are actual locations in the Nashville area.

Players start as struggling musicians and have to collect four items (e.g. an agent and a publishing contract) to establish a career, at which point they have to collect things such as a US tour and a gold album, etc.; there are four levels of success in all.

The game was self-published under the name "Grabbitt & Hyde."

Name: Black Hats
Description:
Forget about range, cover, and terrain - on this virtual battlefield you trade trenches for subnets and fire support for computer daemons. The battles on the network aren't fought with soldiers, they're fought with runners: hackers who compete over lucrative data servers, filled with corporate secrets.

Black Hats is a head-to-head skirmish-sized tactics game. Players take turns commanding their runners, spending crypto to support them with cards from a custom-built cyberdeck, and hacking the network upon which you play. There are dozens of runners and cards to choose from in deck building, allowing you to craft a strategy that feels unique to you and your crew.

The tactical core of the game revolves around the hacking mechanic. Territory on the board is defined by connecting groups of same-colored hexes into "subnets," but both players can change the color of any space at any time, reshaping the board as you play. An enemy that sits across the board may be absolutely unreachable or just a single space away and, if you can outsmart your opponent, you control which.

Hire your crew, customize your cyberdeck, and hack your way to an early retirement. This is Black Hats!

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Owonikoko (The Money Hustle)
Description:
Owonikoko is played over seven rounds in which all players are engaged in the money hustle, striving to be the richest at the end of the game.

On active player’s turn the following actions are possible, however only 3 actions are permitted on active turn. This can be a combination of any action here or a repetition of one totaling 3 actions.
1.    Draw card: player draws a card from the top of the draw deck
2.    Play an action card (A.C): player plays an action card from hand and resolves said action
3.    Play a counteraction card (C.C): player plays a counteraction card to stop or effect current active action
4.    Sell goods: play goods card and gain gold accordingly

When not the active player, only one action is possible and permitted during other players turn
1.    Play a counteraction card: play a C.C card to cancel effect of an active card, however this can only be done once while that player is active.

End of Game:
At the end of seven rounds, all players reveal their gold and richest player wins. If players tie, player with most goods win, if not they share victory.

-description from designer

Name: Guess in 10: States of America
Description:
EXCITING GAME OF QUESTIONS – Ask up to 10 questions to guess the state on the Game Card! Does this state have a lot of beaches? Are the Red Sox from this state? Be the first player to win 7 game cards!

ABOUT THE GAME – This game is all about the 50 states of America! Learn all about what these states are known for, their characteristics, how they were named, & more in this super fun game of guessing! This game is for 2-6 Players.

WHAT’S INSIDE – Includes 50 Game Cards and 6 Clue Cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Corrida dos Bichos
Description:
A fun race in which each player represents an animal, but no player knows who is what. Walking with all the animals is a way to confuse the players. The first three to cross the finish line receive medals, but only the player with the most gold medals is the winner. Come on, start the race and don't let them know you're winning.

Each player secretly draws an animal that they must represent and receive three cards.

On their turn, each player must choose one of the cards in his hand to discard and walk the same number of spaces indicated on the card, with the same animal drawn on it. Then he draws a card to replace his hand.

Special cards are used to bring new dynamics to the game.
The player whose animal crosses the finish line first will win.

Name: Brutal Quest: Fantasy Narrative Skirmish Gaming Based on the Planet 28 Rules
Description:
Brutal Quest is a fantasy narrative skirmish game, built on the Planet 28 rules engine.

Brutal quest is designed to provide you with a set of simple wargames rules, allowing for fast and exciting games of miniature combat with warbands of kitbashed characters.

These rules can also be expanded with the in-depth campaign and narrative systems included, allowing you to add roleplay sessions, individual warband goals and long form story archs to your battles.

This book contains all the rules you need to play a game of brutal quest including custom character creation and advice on running campaigns.

Also included are a set of paper miniatures to allow you to get playing asap.

—description from the publisher

Name: Berlin'84: A Cold War 3! Skirmish Level Wargame in Berlin
Description:
BERLIN ’84: Skirmish Rules for Cold War3!

August 1984, after tensions rise the unthinkable has happened! 
World War III has started with the Soviet invasion of West Germany. 
Berlin is surrounded and left to it’s fate with no possibility of being relieved or replenished, the units stationed in Berlin are in the fight of their lives as they are attacked on all sides by the East German Grenztruppen (Border Guards). 
Desperate city fighting ensues.

Take command of either British or East German forces in street to street fighting in Berlin. 
Each model represents one model and each side fields sections, with a platoon being the largest force fielded (though a company is do-able just rather large and may require more than two players!). 
Each model can move and fight, with a simple wounding system.
Tanks are formidable beasts but can still be brought to their knees by rocket launchers and skill full tactics.

This title is fully compatible with ALL other titles produced by Rooksdown Games and written by Dean Wilson; so any title can be used in conjunction with this book, bringing your games of WWIII to a new level.

SIX (6) unique city fight scenarios are included as well as a full army lists for the (UK) Berlin Brigade including stats for the FV432/30 with 30mm Fox A/C Turret and for the East German Grenz. Regt. With BTR-152’s, T-55am’s and UAZ jeeps with RPG-11 recoilless rifles.

-description from the publisher

Name: Pays de Vitré-Fougères: Le jeu
Description:
Pays de Vitré-Fougères is a local board game based on the principle of questions and answers.

Players start in one of the town centers of the Vitré-Fougères, and then go discover all the sectors with 550 questions relating to geography, history, local celebrities....

Name: Superhero
Description:
A rock-paper-scissors card game with superheroes theme. Every player will be dealt a number of cards and they need to challenge other players during the game to keep their cards. 
The superheroes cards correspond to three different elements: water, fire  or woods, each one beats another one.

The player will the challenge card will challenge any other player. Both cards will take one card from their hands and at the shout of "Water, Fire, Wood!" they will reveal their cards. The stronger elements winds and the winner will gets both cards (unless there is a Power Eraser, that can be only used once). If both cards are identical, they are discarded.

The last player still having cards in their hands will be the winner of the game.

-description from designer

Name: Scoop
Description:
This game is a trivia game in the paper press world. It has no relation to the game Scoop from 1953.

The aim of the game it to become editor in chief of one of the ten newspaper of the game To achieve this, the player must create a team of journalists in a newspaper  to become a section editor and then editor in chief.

At the beginning of the game a player is the advisor and place its pawn in the middle of the board. The first player start the roulette on the board, when its stops, he adjusts the board to be able to enter into a newspaper building. He will then have to answer to a question thanks to a combination of numbers on the board. If he answers right, he places a pawn of his color in the newspaper. He has begun his journalist team. If his answer his wring, he becomes the advisor. The others player can try to answer to the question during the hourglass time. The first that answer become a journalist in the newspaper.

Once all players are journalists in the same newspaper they can proceed the same to access to the chief of section rank. When a player is chief of section he proceeds the same to become editor in chief.

The first to be editor in chief wins.

Name: Rätselspaß auf dem Bauernhof
Description:
On the farm all the animals have escaped. Who will help catch them? The players solve fun logic puzzles and learn where the animals are hiding. By matching, comparing and combining, the educational game playfully promotes logical thinking. Where are the eggs hidden? Which animal can crow?

—description from the publisher

This game works with the tiptoi-pen and can't be played without it.

Name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Chapter Approved – Munitorium Field Manual 2021 Mk1
Description:
The official guide from Games Workshop, providing points values for all units in the Warhammer 40,000 system.

Provided as a Promotional inclusion to White Dwarf #462 (March 2021)

Name: Entlang der Straße der Romanik Eine Quizreise durch Sachsen-Anhalt
Description:
A quiz game (600 questions) that requires, as the name suggests, knowledge of Germany's state Saxony-Anhalt.

Players take turns to roll 2 dice and move the number of fields by either one die or by both dice round the track. The player then tries to answer a question determined by the black die (results 1, 2 or 3).

If the question is answered correctly the player receives chips, depending on the color of the field, he landed on. If the answer is wrong, a second player is given the question. A special field (the City of Magdeburg) gives the players the opportunity earning more chips. Everyone has to stay on Magdeburg till the last Player arrives getting each turn Questions with potential more points. Then the second part starts.

The game ends when the first player comes the second time to Magdeburg (different track).

The winner is the player to collect the highest value of chips.

Name: Dino Hunt
Description: Two players try to remove dinosaurs from the their holes using suction hammers.  The first player to achieve one of three goals (remove all the dinosaurs of their colour first, remove more dinosaurs than the other player, or remove the dinosaurs with the most total points) wins the game.

Name: Suburbs!
Description:
Simple and quick tile-laying discard party game, where parks and cul-de-sacs are not always a good thing, and where chance and strategy play equal parts.

In this uno-meets-domino game, your goal is to get rid of all the cards in your hand before other players, accumulating points each round.

Each card placed changes what can be played and where, so strategy allows you to plan for your hand, while frustrating the plans of other players.

Gameplay:
- Cards represent parts of a road/street – straight roads, bends, intersections, cul-de-sacs and a few parks.
- Each player is dealt a number of cards to their hand, depending on the number of players. One more card is placed face up on the table, as a starter for the neighborhood.
- In your turn, you must lay down a card from your hand that correctly connects to at least one other card on the table.
- There are a few special cards that make other players get a punishment (extra cards).
- First player to get rid of all their cards wins the round, and gets the points from other players’ cards.
- After several rounds, the winner is the first player to get to 200 points. For a quick filler you can also play without scoring, just to see who wins the round.

Suburbs! can be played from 2 to 10 players.

-description from designer

Name: How to Train Your Dragon: The Hidden World Path Game
Description:
From the How to Train Your Dragon: Hidden World movie.  Spin to move along the path and collect Dragon Tokens along the way.  But watch out for the Dragon Catchers!  The player with the most Tokens at the end of the path is the winner.

Includes: 4 character movers, 4 character stands, 1 light fury token, 1 spinner, 1 gameboard, 50 dragon tokens.
Families: Movies: How to Train Your Dragon

Name: Cthulhu Detective
Description:
In the "Cthulhu Detective" adventure game, players take up investigations of different tangled cases and mysterious stories. Players are gathering clues, interrogating suspects and matching pieces of information to successfully solve the case.

During each turn, a player chooses one of the cards available this turn. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, Special Action,  etc. Using the cards, which were received during investigation, a player discovers what actually happened. The objective is to solve a case in a minimum number of turns.

-description from publisher

Name: Hedge Lord
Description:
The Gentleperson's wager proclaims that who shall ever escape the maze, or be left the sole survivor of the beasts, shall be named the most honorable Hedge Lord, inheriting the splendid estates of all participants.

Hedge Lord is a game for 2-4 players where you are trying to get your lord out the exit on the opposite end of the hedge maze or to be the last lord standing.  On your turn you roll the die and flip a coin.  The die roll determines the movement of your lord and/or your beast.  The coin flip determines whether or not you may rotate a hedge piece one quarter turn.  Be careful!  If your lord shares a space with another player's beast your lord (and beast) are out of the game!

Victory is not official until you take the flag, wave it in the air and proudly proclaim, "I am the Hedge Lord!"

Name: Verflucht!: Der Hinterhalt
Description:
Promotional post card.
Place the ambush postcard next to the creatures display area.

Name: Rilium
Description:
Have you ever had the feeling of opening a book and jumping into a sea of memories?

That’s because somewhere far away, in the depths of the ocean, there is a mystical library inhabited by a girl and her family of fish. Today, you’ll be able to help her organize the books for you alone.
Who will have the greatest joy while visiting your personal underwater library?

This game consists of two parts: the first part is called “Acquisitions” and the second part is called “Reading”. In the Acquisition section, you will collect books at the library by writing them on the library sheet, and in the reading section, you will read the books you have acquired. Read, and strive to make your library experience as pleasant as possible.

Name: Intrepid: Mission Critical
Description:
Intrepid: Mission Critical is the first expansion for Intrepid: the cooperative and asymmetric survival game. It includes four new characters, with astronauts from Brazil, Germany, Malaysia, and the United Kingdom. Also included are 4 new Career Badges, giving you more variability. Test your skill against the Solar Storm, our most devastating disaster yet. Only the bravest crews will survive.

Components:
4 career boards
4 country boards (Germany, Malaysia, Brazil, UK)
4 country player aids
76 double-sided station tiles (19 per country)
1 disaster aid
22 disaster cards (solar storm)
6 unlock tokens (for Brazil)
4 country trays with lids
1 rulebook

Included in the Kickstarter edition (fulfilled September 2021)

Name: Intrepid: South Africa Mini Expansion
Description:
An exclusive Kickstarter character that was available as an add-on. It will be unavailable to the general public for at least 12 months after its release.

The South African astronaut rolls their dice into a single queue and are restricted to using only the dice at the queue's front. Dice further back in the queue are quite flexible and easy to manipulate but are much harder to gain access to. Thankfully, the South African astronaut has the ability to cycle the dice from the front to the back of the queue, allowing other dice to move forward - and hopefully provide access to the numbers they need.

Components:
2 career boards
2 country boards (South Africa 1 and 2)
2 country player aids
38 double-sided station tiles (19 per country)
2 country trays with lids
1 rulebook

Name: Sea of Legends: Tantrum House Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack contains two cards and was made available in the 2020 Tantrum House Kickstarter.

Ruffian: Exhaust to discard 1 Crew and gain their Gold value in Bonus dice.

Rogue: Exhaust after you take a Port action to gain 3 Gold.

Name: Death Cube
Description:
In Death Cube, you are trying not to be crushed by blocks — or to crush people with blocks — depending on your role that turn.

The game takes place in a 4x5 grid that bears the numbers 1-20. Each turn, five spaces are covered on this grid based on whichever of the forty puzzle cards is chosen at random. If you are the "organizer", you are then presented with two pentominoes — i.e., five connected cubes — from a set of five pentominoes, and you have 24 seconds in which to decide how to fit these two pentominoes into the remaining 15 spaces of the grid. (The two are chosen at random from four possible choices, which means the game includes 160 total puzzles.)

If you're not the organizer, then you are a "participant", and you want to find a safe square among those 15 spaces where you will not be crushed by a block. Some squares will definitely be safe based on the pentominoes in the challenge, whereas other squares will be safe only depending on how the organizer decides to place the blocks. When you've made your choice, grab the numbered tile matching your chosen space so that no one else can take it.

Name: 金庫バトル (Safe Battle)
Description: In the game é‡‘åº«ãƒãƒˆãƒ« (Safe Battle), you and your fellow players are master locksmiths who have gathered at a national tournament to open four safes by listening to their sounds. You can try to open them in co-operation with other locksmiths or go for a solo victory by relying solely on your own ears.

Name: Alien Mating Calls
Description:
Alien Mating Calls is a hilarious party game that combines performing, deduction, and trickery. Your goal in the game is to score points by correctly pairing up with other players - while having the severe and silly limitation of only making alien noises.

The game is played over 6 rounds. A round begins with the first player prepping one of the alien decks and dealing each player one card. The card you get is your alien card for the round, and is kept secret from other players.

Players go around the table once, making a noise they think their alien might make. This is their clue to other players what alien they have. Then players simultaneously begin making their alien noises, during which each player decides to either pair up with another player by fist bumping them, or not pair up. When all players are ready to proceed, players reveal their alien cards.

Players score points based on how they paired up, with maximum points awarded to pairs of players who were alien partners and to single players who did not pair up and didn't have their partner in play. The player with the most points at the end of 6 rounds wins.

Subjective interpretations and the chance of a devious Mimic being in play makes commitment risky, and surprising misunderstandings are common. Optional Mood cards modify player calls, adding more replayability.

-description from designer

Name: Quarry Quarrel
Description:
Quarry Quarrel is a card-collecting game that works in voting rounds: all players secretly vote on which face-up card pile they want to collect, but if any pile gets multiple votes, then no one gets it!

Outsmart your opponents so you can add to your hand or stop them in their tracks. And discard sets of 3 cards between votes to draw more cards, double your points, or even end the game early.

The game ends when the Game Over! card is drawn or when a player ends the game early. The player with the most points in hand wins!

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Darkness & Light – Mystic Arts
Description:
A myriad of masters of the mystic arts match up in this exciting issue of Vs. System® 2PCG®! You'll find both powerful heroes and villains alike whose only common bond is the ability to wield
magic and sorcery. Will they be able to work together, or will they unleash chaos upon your deck...

Contents:
55 Playable Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Darkness & Light – Masters of Evil
Description:
This volume of Vs. System 2PCG kicks off with a polarizing story arc blending the forces of good and evil. First up are the true masters of evil - a dastardly collection of the most nefarious villains, banded together with a new team affiliation. This set introduces Baron Heinrich Zemo, Radioactive Man, and more!

Contents:
55 Playable Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: The Omegas
Description:
In this aptly named conclusion to the Omega level story arc for Vs. System 2PCG, your deck will be filled with an A-list of powerful mutants. Massive mutant ability will surely classify your deck as Omega. Vs. System 2PCG: The Omegas includes some of the mightiest mutants like Jean Grey, Legion, and Storm whose Omega level powers are among the most dominant in the Vs. System 2PCG game. The level of advantage this issue brings to your deck can only be classified as, Omega.

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

Name: Vs. System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Freedom Force
Description:
What happens when you give control of your deck to a band of “reformed” ruffians? The shapeshifting Mystique leads her version of the evil Brotherhood of Mutants with a cast of characters who will create law and order by any means necessary. Build your deck with the power of questionable tactics that yield unquestionable results. Freedom Force is the second issue in the Omega Level story arc and includes the incendiary Pyro, the ground shaking Avalanche and more!

Contents:
55 Cards
Rulesheet

This is not a stand-alone game. A copy of any Vs. System 2PCG stand-alone game is required to play.

Name: Vs System 2PCG: Marvel – Omega Level: Futures Past
Description:
Futures Past is the 1st issue of the Omega Level story arc.

It expands on the ever popular roster of heroes and villains from the X-Men family of characters. This issue is a tragic reminder that there's just no stopping the mutant-hunting robotic Sentinels, as they scour the globe, intent on decimating all mutantkind with their iron fists! This nightmarish scenario facing your deck is well balanced by the likes of powerful mutants like Kitty Pryde and Logan!

Contents:
55 Cards
1 Rulesheet

Name: Roll 'N Score: Official Toronto Maple Leafs Hockey Game
Description: Roll 'N Score is a dice game with rules very much like real hockey. Two teams play against each other. There are power plays, breakaways, and penalties-just like real hockey. As you play, the totals on the dice, when you have rolled them, tell you where to move. The squares on which you land tell you what to do (for example, penalty of " holding" -you go to the penalty box for two turns). Everything your team does-goals, assists and penalties-is written on the scoresheet.

Name: Carrots
Description:
Object of the game is to end the game with the most carrots.  Players will have to masterfully decide to Farm, Steal, Gamble, Bank, or use Rabbit Hole cards to obtain carrots.  There are 5 rabbits to choose from. On setup of the game the player will choose to either be the Farmer, Thief, Gambler, Tax Collector, or Insurance Broker. Each rabbit has their own special ability.  There are three piles of cards (Farm, Steal, and Rabbit Hole).  You start off with 24 cards in each deck, any extra cards will be removed from the decks and placed in the box. Thirty carrots per player will be used to create the Harvest.

A player's turn will consist of the following:
1. Remove any Closed Tokens that were put into play on their last turn.
2. Receive any carrots via farming or banking. If a player cannot receive any carrots they will receive 1 carrot from the harvest.
3. The player will complete one of the following.
A. Purchase a Farm Card (Cost 0 carrots)
B. Purchase a Steal Card (Cost 1 Carrot)
C. Purchase a Rabbit Hole Card (Cost 3 Carrots) Rabbit Hole Cards may be played at anytime during the player's turn.  The only exception to this rule is if the card has a carrot with a lightning bolt and or a rabbit with a fire on its head.
D. Gamble
E. Bank *Note if more than 4 carrots were banked on the player's last turn, they may not bank this turn.

If one of the card piles or the Harvest gets depleted, this will trigger the end game. Any Rabbit Hole cards left will be counted as 2 carrots unless card otherwise specifies.  The player with the most carrots wins. In the event of a tie, the player who took their final turn earlier will be declared the winner.

-description from designer

Name: ツクルテン (Total Ten)
Description:
In ãƒ„ã‚¯ãƒ«ãƒ†ãƒ³ (Tsukuruten), you score points in the round if you can add up the eight cards in front of you to sum to 10. This challenge is complicated by the deck containing eight cards each of numbers 1-7, with half the cards being red and half blue — which means almost every set of eight cards will sum to more than 10!

The trick is that certain combinations of cards are worth less than their face value:


    Three cards of the same color and number = 0
    Three red cards in sequence are worth only the highest number in the sequence, so a red 345 = 5.
    Three blue cards in sequence are worth only the lowest number in the sequence, so a blue 345 = 3.


Each player starts with a hand of eight cards. On a turn, draw a card from the deck, then (if you don't have a sum of 10) discard a card in a row in front of you; alternatively, you can pick up the discarded card of the player before you, add two cards from your hand to this card, play it beside you as a special sequence (a "get"), then discard a card. The cards in that "get" cannot be altered for the remainder of this deal, but they still count as being in your hand toward the desired sum of 10.

When someone does reach a sum of 10, whether by drawing a card or picking up a discarded card, the round ends, with players scoring points based on the combinations they've made and certain conditions in their hand. Having only one 7 in hand is worth 1 point, for example, as is having four red and four blue cards, whereas having all cards of one color or two triples are each worth 3 points. You also score points for being the one to end the round.

Play enough rounds so that each player starts a hand twice, then whoever has the most points wins. Alternatively, if a player collects a "God Ten" — that is, all eight 2s or all eight 5s, each of which sums to 10 — they win the game instantly!

Name: Go Adventure
Description:
Go Adventure is a family-friendly card game that was inspired by one of the game creators going out on 'adventures' with his son. Sometimes their adventures didn't always go as planned. This hard-learned lesson to pack appropriately gave way to inspire children to also think creatively about going out on adventures. The objective of the game is to fully “pack” the required items needed to go on eight different adventures. The gameplay is simple and straightforward. The cards are brightly colored and cheery. Laughter will certainly ensue.

Players can only play one card during their turn but they have four choices of card type to play. They can play a Required Item card on an adventure thereby 'packing that item'. If the player places the last required item needed to be packed for an adventure, then they get to keep that adventure card pile. This drives the primary objective of the game. The remaining choices purely drive the fun secondary elements of the game. A player can use a Skip-a-Turn card thereby skipping the next player in order. A player can use a Funny Action card, which forces someone in the group to do something fun and silly that relates to the adventure themes. Lastly, a player can use a Random Item card, which can be placed on any of the adventures but the player must make up a story about how that item will be used on the specific adventure. This adds a fun storytelling element to the game. Gameplay continues until all eight adventures have been fully “packed” for and the winner is the player with the most completely packed adventure piles in their possession.

Go Adventure is unique in its mission to get kids thinking about what adventure means to them as well as what needs to be packed to go on adventures. The gameplay is quick, around fifteen minutes, and the storytelling element will continue to provide exciting replayability for families. Any extra inspiration kids and parents find to get out there and go on new adventures is free of charge!

-description from publisher

Name: ラムラムパーティー (Lum Lum Party)
Description:
ãƒ©ãƒ ãƒ©ãƒ ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ãƒ¼ (Lum Lum Party) is a bingo-type game where the players are given two blank bingo sheets and following a set of rules, will choose what numbers go in each box.

On a turn, a player chooses from 4 actions in order to "call" the next number the players will hope to circle on their sheets.  These actions will vary slightly depending upon the last number "called".

At the end of a round, players score points for their place in getting their first bingo; numbers circled; and tens-digits of numbers circled.  The player with the highest total score after two rounds wins.

Nearly a quarter of the rules are devoted to the designer's love of the manga series, Urusei Yatsura; this is where the game gets its name.

Name: Strange Victory
Description: A solitaire design, this game illustrates how the smaller but nimbler Germans got "inside" the Allied decision cycle to constantly impose small delays and major "rethinks" producing a catastrophic failure on the Allied side - though the better the Germans do may well panic their own High Command into halting them.
